subject: Climate & Environment
title: Coastal Cities at Risk
description: A short lesson to help you apply Coastal Cities at Risk.

hook.text: Over 800 million people live in coastal cities less than 10 meters above sea level.

buildup.text: Miami, Shanghai, Mumbai, Lagos, and Jakarta all face increasing flood risk from rising seas.

discovery.text: Jakarta is sinking so fast â€” up to 25 cm per year â€” that Indonesia is building a new capital inland.

twist.text: Sea walls can buy time, but they are expensive and only work until the water overtops them.

climax.text: By 2100, trillions of dollars in coastal property could be underwater permanently.

punchline.text: The world built its biggest cities at the edge of a rising ocean.

quiz.question: Why is Indonesia building a new capital city?
options: Jakarta is sinking rapidly and flooding frequently
The government wants a more central location
